channel.title: USPTO Patent Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Patent events.

item.title: Patent Public Advisory Committee public meeting
item.description: Attend the next public meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) to learn more about patent-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. You can watch the virtual public session via WebEx. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: Learn how to conduct a patent search at the USPTO Texas Regional Office
item.description: Are you interested in learning more about patent searching?Register today to attend this in-person, interactive session on December 5 from 10-11:30 a.m. CT, led by United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts who will demonstrate how to conduct a patent search using the Patent Public Search tool.Participants will learn basic information about:Conducting a preliminary U.S. patent searchThe six-step patentability search strategyPatent searching toolsThis new web-based patent search tool replaces legacy search tools Public-Examiner's Automated Search Tool (PubEast), Public-Web-based Examiner's Search Tool (PubWest), Patent Full-Text and Image Database (PatFT), and Patent Application Full-Text and Image Database (AppFT), which were retired in September 2022.Register todayFor more information about patent searching, visit the search for patents page on the USPTO website.For questions about this event, email the USPTO's Texas Regional Office at TexasRegionalOffice@uspto.gov or call 469-295-9000. Please feel free to bring your laptop and follow along. This event is strictly in-person and will not provide a virtual component.

item.title: Ex Parte Appeal Roadshows - Los Angeles
item.description: Are you a Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) practitioner? Would you like to learn more about ex parte appeal proceedings directly from PTAB judges? Attend an Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow.The PTAB is holding in-person training focusing on best practices to succeed in an appeal on Thursday, December 7, at the Los Angeles Central Library from 1-5 p.m. PT. PTAB judges will teach all sessions. Topics include:Tips to file an appeal brief efficientlyHow to make written arguments more persuasiveHow to present an effective oral argument before a judge panelSee the agenda for more information. The event is free and registration is encouraged. The Ex Parte Appeal Roadshow will also take place in Austin, Atlanta, Indianapolis, and Philadelphia. See the full schedule for dates. If you have any questions regarding this event, please email PTABEvents@uspto.gov.CLE credit is pending per state for each roadshow location.
